intro: Ornithogalum flavescens, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its bulbous root system and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
